title: Designing a “front panel” for Unix: the evolution of a metaphor
proctitle: CHI '95: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: Jay Lundell
authors.institution: Corvallis User Interface Lab Hewlett Packard MS 4UE3, 1000 N.E. Circle Blvd., Corvallis, OR

authors.name: Steve Anderson
authors.institution: User Interaction Design Group, Hewlett Packard, 1266 Kifer Road, Sunnyvale, CA

references.text: Carroll, J.M., Mack, R.L., & Kellogg, W.A. Interface metaphors and user interface design. In M. Helander (Ed.), Handbook of Human-Computer Interaction, Elsevier Science Publishers B.V., 1988.
Erickson, T.D. Working with interface metaphors. In B. Laurel (Ed.), The Art of Human- Computer Interface Design, Addison-Wesley Publishing Co., Inc. 1990.
Gentner, D. Structure mapping: A theoretical framework for analogy. Cognitive Science, 7, 155-170.
Grudin, J. The case against user interface consistency. Communications of the ACM, vol. 32, number 10, 1164-1173, 1989.
Mountford, S.J. Tools and techniques for creative design. In B. Laurel (Ed.), The Art of Human-Computer Interface Design, Addison-Wesley Publishing Co., Inc. 1990.
Rideout, T., & Lundell, J. Hewlett Packard's Usability Engineering Program. In M. E. Wiklund (Ed.), Usability in Practice. AP Professional, 1994.
